text: in every single how to k-kat video I
begin by removing my cakes from their
pans removing the parchment paper
leveling the cakes with a ruler and a
serrated knife and cutting them in half
horizontally so I'm going to show you
how to do that right now this is a
beautiful 10-inch chocolate cake I use a
short ruler it's just more comfortable
to hold against the cake so I hold it
down to my lazy susan and then I level
the cake according to publication I
always bake my cakes in a 3-inch high
different recipes vary but generally my
cakes bake at about two inches high or
maybe two and a quarter inches high
depending on the cake flavor so I always
leveled them at one and three-quarter
inches tall so I just mark one and
three-quarter inches all the way around
so just mark at intervals all the way
around 1 and 3/4 inches the reason we
level cakes is to get them nice and flat
and even on top and to remove this job
one of the number one questions I get is
how to bake a cake without a dome but
there isn't always an answer for that I
love my chocolate cake recipe it bakes
with a dome I cut off the dough I like
to begin by cutting around my cake with
a serrated knife but don't cut too far
in just make a very shallow cut to sort
of connect the dots
take your time use your lazy susan spin
the cake with your other hand and then
once you've connected all the dots start
to cut deeper and try to have your knife
all the way in because if you do it like
this you actually can end up cutting a
little crater in your case you don't
want to do it you want to have your
knife flat once you're around bring your
knife deeper into the cake into the
center but
still going around don't be tempted to
cut across
now we can cut this cake in half
horizontally so if our cake was one in
three quarters high then the half mark
is 7/8 so we're going to mark the same
way seven eighths of an inch you can do
whatever measurement you like but this
is what I do this is the same technique
we use to remove the dome just going
around making a slight indent and then
taking our knife and connecting the dots
and then cutting deeper round and round
in a circle until we've cut our cake so
I always bake two cakes to make one
complete cake and what I like to do is
move the cake onto a board and then I
like to flip this layer and the reason
is cakes because of the dome they always
kind of taper in a little bit so this
sort of when I ice will help me even it
out because I can fill in that taper
with buttercream when I crumb coat let's
do that one more time
so there you have it I hope I've
